column5: I‚Äôm not gonna reiterate everything that‚Äôs being said to counter your point already. Adults still struggle with gender and sexual identity because of internal and external factors. Sexual awakenings can occur at any age. There is a thing as cognitive dissonance, you can genuinely trick yourself into believe something if you try hard enough.

Bisexuality isn‚Äôt changing, it just as valid of an orientation. Even with bisexuality is the struggle of figuring out if you‚Äôre gay or straight and a lot of it comes from bi erasure such as this comment. Society belittles bisexuals to the point that they become just as confused.

As a 24 year old bi woman I still face internal conflicts on whether I‚Äôve ‚Äúfigured myself out‚Äù or not.
Where the hell are you getting your misinformation. Do you know anything about sexual psychology?

Something was off about me early on. I wasn‚Äôt a problem child, but I was in the counselors office on a weekly basis up until 2nd grade. Someone, maybe one of my teachers noticed something was up. I first cut myself at 10 and my parents punished me for begging for attention. Even if it‚Äôs for attention, a child calls out for the needed attention they‚Äôre being denied. 

I‚Äôve been depressed for as long as I can remember. Around freshman year I got the idea that I was maybe bipolar. I begged to see a psychologist which I only saw twice, once after almost jumping off the second floor. Mid twenties now and after receiving health insurance for the first time in years my suspicions were confirmed. Psychiatrist believes I‚Äôve been bipolar for years, maybe most of my life.

I ‚Äúdated‚Äù an almost 30 year old at 18. Looking back, idgaf if I was legal. What do we have in common? I had just graduated high school. That‚Äôs fucking weird. Date women your age.

Your brain is fully developed by 25. Not saying you‚Äôre not an adult until then, but like you said; three years is a world of a difference. If you can‚Äôt drink till you‚Äôre 21, you shouldn‚Äôt be able to enlist until then. 

I wasn‚Äôt all that wild when I was 18, but even then I was making some childish decisions much like everyone at eighTEEN.
Nonheterosexual orientation is not an illness nor a paraphilia. Lumping these two together is not only incredibly offensive, but objectively incomparable.
What does this have to do with anything. Since when is the left the pedophile party??

The scariest part is most pedophiles never molest. As someone who was molested by a pedophile, I personally believe there‚Äôs something psychologically wrong like any other disorder. 

Like a psychopath, not every psychopath is a murderer, but there is something pathologically wrong. As much as a resent my molester (I‚Äôd love to find out he was beaten to death), I pity the ‚Äúbenign‚Äù ones. I‚Äôd imagine those with self awareness hate themselves. 

It‚Äôs uncomfortable to humanize, but it‚Äôs the only way to better understand and possibly fix because they can‚Äôt just go away. If they are born this way, maybe we can find markers to prevent or even remove.

But, I agree that acting pedophiles deserve heavy punishment. Too often do I wonder how different my life would be without my childhood trauma

Romeo and Juliet Law, if I remember correctly it‚Äôs okay with parental consent for a minor to marry as long as the difference in under four years. Could be worse, but still fucked.

I used to joke about being bipolar because I genuinely believed it was a real possibility. Years later here I am with a diagnosis. I kind of just always knew that it wasn‚Äôt just ‚Äúpuberty‚Äù. I‚Äôm 24 now and was diagnosed mid to late last year.

Two of my friends whom used to joke about it loosely were also diagnosed recently as BP2. Makes me think that birds of a feather really do flock together.

Sure, we cope with comedy, but I‚Äôd go as far as to say that most of the jokes are coming from people who don‚Äôt fully grasp the severity of the situation. You have to grasp it to come to cope with it.

Everyone I know joking about it is genuinely laughing their asses off. I‚Äôve been annoyed for days, I had to unfollow a bunch of people. I posted about this yesterday and all I was met with was *okay boomer*. Because everything is a fucking meme and a joke.

Like can we please, please, please maybe take something seriously for once. I guess I can‚Äôt paint everyone, but social media as a whole right now is using this as meme fuel

Bipolar 2 and ADHD on adderall. It has changed my life entirely. I don‚Äôt get high off of it at all and definitely hasn‚Äôt triggered any mania for me. Sure, maybe the first two days of being on it I felt a little hypomanic because it was new to my system, but I‚Äôve been on it for 5 months now? It‚Äôs been a life saver, for real. I‚Äôd fall asleep  left and right without it.

I‚Äôm a leftist and a feminist and I know that the majority of the left would be quick to shame me for saying that men need a form of male revolution. True feminism addresses a lot of male issues, but like I said before. Men need their own man started movement. Not like the internet trolling ‚Äúmeninists‚Äù that only bring up male suicide rates to counteract any form of female uplifting, but a true rewriting of man. I‚Äôm talking men wearing what they want, men talking about what they want, men choosing not to be ‚Äúmanly‚Äù because ‚Äúmanliness‚Äù is old and outdated and has no real place. Femininity and masculinity and yin and yang and we all have both. There is not shame in being human and no human emotional should dictate how you feel about yourself as a person and your role as one. I could go on forever but I‚Äôll get off my soapbox because I think you‚Äôd agree

The world is cruel and unfair and it takes a different kind of bravery to accept the social punishment. It‚Äôs fucked up beyond belief. Both genders are emotional, because humans are emotional beings. But you also have to consider the female depression doesn‚Äôt look like it does in movies and tv. It is heavily romanticized and we‚Äôre seen as manic pixies, ‚Äúcrazy in bed‚Äù, a good fuck that shouldn‚Äôt be dated. Yeah, we‚Äôre paid attention to, because women have always been seen as a spectacle regardless of the context. Again, it‚Äôs different problems that the other side doesn‚Äôt understand.

As far as social punishment for real mental illness exists for everyone. Real depression is isolation, it‚Äôs people getting angry at you for not answering phone calls. It‚Äôs me hiding bipolar disorder from my ‚Äúlogical and facts driven‚Äù brother and my female friends leaving me when I was off the handle.

That‚Äôs real life, not what movies and social media shows us. Unfortunately both of those outlets have a nasty way of bending our perceptions, but it‚Äôs sucks that men can‚Äôt be vulnerable and women are to be believed as impervious.

Edit: As far as men dealing with it alone, I don‚Äôt mean literally. We should all back each other up. But, it‚Äôll take men to start their own movement that I personally think is overdue for you guys and it‚Äôs a shame that I truly feel pain over. Not all men backed women, and not all women will back men. It is what it is. Every movement that‚Äôs ever existed had pushback, that‚Äôs why its a movement to begin with

Because the majority of men don‚Äôt have a strong emotional support foundations amongst each other. That‚Äôs not to say they can‚Äôt have strong friendships, but guys typically don‚Äôt handle talking about feelings well. The way women have slowly taken to ‚Äúredefining what it means to be a woman‚Äù, men need to do them same for themselves. The same way that way back when a woman dared to wear pants, men need to actively fight the status quo even if it means they have to do it alone. Men deserve to be vulnerable.

Guys have a lot of problems that need to be dealt with and it shouldn‚Äôt only rise when talking about the other gender or as a means to shut women up. We all have separate problems that the other may never understand and that‚Äôs okay.

I‚Äôm not a guy, but as a woman whose had many guy friends I was always the one they confided in when talking about their issues because as a whole we‚Äôve been socially better equipped for it. And that‚Äôs not men attempting to be vulnerable to get into my pants as some cynical 20 year old would say. I mean dudes opening up to me about their suicidal ideations because they felt uncomfortable talking about it to their male friends.

As a whole, most people don‚Äôt give a shit about whether you‚Äôre depressed or not, regardless of gender. You see it in the memes we share. Everyone jokes about being depressed and crying out into a void that only blinks back in the form upvotes and laugh reacts. We mask it as a joke, but the reality is that. It‚Äôs not solidarity, it‚Äôs not normalizing metal illness as much as people wanna say it does. A lot of people are depressed and no one cares unless the problem is either yours or close to you.

I feel estranged. I worked so hard to get myself to where I am and now that I‚Äôm here I realize I‚Äôm the furthest I‚Äôve ever been to feeling actualized. I don‚Äôt want to say I wasted my time, because it‚Äôs serve me well financially (arguably). But I truly feel lost at sea.

I‚Äôm currently in the healthcare field working at a hospital. I think I absolutely hate my job.

Update: I just got diagnosed like 2 days after I saw this post. I mentioned that I have difficulty concentrating and staying on task, mostly really just *being* regardless of whether I‚Äôm manic or depressed. 

When I first brought it up I was manic so he wanted to see if it‚Äôs change, but the adhd symptoms which sometimes look like mania or hypomania have always kind of been a constant.

My executive functioning has done a 180 this past week and maybe it‚Äôs a bit of hypomania, but it‚Äôs different than I‚Äôve ever felt before and I‚Äôm feeling a lot more hopeful. I work at a hospital and the 12 hour shifts haven‚Äôt been feeling as torturous.

I wish you the best of luck, because I believe this diagnosis is really gonna be one of the best things that have happened to me.

I‚Äôm gonna say it: regardless of whether you think it‚Äôs ‚Äúfor attention‚Äù doesn‚Äôt change the fact that a mentally sound person doesn‚Äôt make the conscious choice to hurt themselves. I hide my scars (be them smaller because I was mortified of being caught), but I started as a child to get attention. A cry for attention sometimes isn‚Äôt necessarily a vanity thing, but an act of desperation. As a child I was so desperate to be taken seriously that I believed hurting myself would be the only way.

Like I said, no mentally sound person does this. This comments section is kind of fucked up especially when I can bet my money that half of you suffer from some form of mental illness/
